name: Burning
description: A creature or object that is on fire takes recurring fire damage each turn until extinguished
trigger: Being ignited by fire sources, alchemist's fire, spells, or other flame effects

damage.timing: at the start of each of its turns

ongoing: Takes 1d4 Fire damage at the start of each of its turns

mitigation: As an action, extinguish fire on yourself by giving yourself the Prone condition and rolling on the ground
Fire goes out if doused with water or other liquids
Fire goes out if submerged in water
Fire goes out if suffocated (deprived of oxygen)

srdReference.quote: A burning creature or object takes 1d4 Fire damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, you can extinguish fire on yourself by giving yourself the Prone condition and rolling on the ground. The fire also goes out if it is doused, submerged, or suffocated.

examples: Object set aflame by a torch
Character affected by flame-based spell with ongoing burning effect
